unnormalised: So, I’ve been delving deeper into yoga beyond just the occasional sun salutation I picked up during my school days at Kendriya Vidyalaya, Delhi. It's more than just a physical workout; it’s a whole lifestyle shift.
normalised: So, I’ve been delving deeper into yoga beyond just the occasional sun salutation I picked up during my school days at Kendriya Vidyalaya, Delhi. It's more than just a physical workout; it’s a whole lifestyle shift.

unnormalised: My journey started properly last year, around Diwali time. I remember feeling incredibly stressed with festival preparations, family gatherings, and all the sweets! My aunt, Priya Aunty, suggested I try a proper yoga session. She's been practicing at the Ramamani Iyengar Memorial Yoga Institute in Pune for over 10 years.

unnormalised: Now, I try to dedicate at least 30 minutes every day, usually before 07:00 hrs, to some asanas. I've found that even simple practices like Tadasana (Mountain Pose) and Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward-Facing Dog) have significantly improved my posture and reduced my back pain – something I frequently experienced after sitting at my desk all day working on my PhD thesis.

unnormalised: Yesterday, on 10/10/2024, I even managed a decent Sirsasana (Headstand) – a feat I never thought possible! I still struggle with Padmasana (Lotus Pose), my knees just won't cooperate! But I’m learning to be patient with myself.

unnormalised: It's not always easy, and some days I skip it (especially when visiting my grandmother in Kolkata – she fills me with so much food, I can barely move!). But I'm committed to making it a regular part of my life. Yoga, for me, is becoming synonymous with wellness – a small ritual for a calmer mind and healthier body. What are some of your go-to yoga practices?
